Continue with generating the instructions for the subsequent parts in the CAD assembly JSON.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 1. The euler angles should be set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector should be [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. This will position the part at the origin of the assembly coordinate system. Draw the 2D sketch Create a new 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch consists of a single face (face_1) with a loop (loop_1) that describes the perimeter of the rectangular prism. The loop consists of four lines (line_1 to line_4) that form a closed shape. The lines have the following start and end points: * line_1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] * line_2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.75] * line_3: [0.75, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.75] * line_4: [0.0, 0.75] to [0.0, 0.0] The length and width of this rectangular prism are both 0.75 units, while the height is 0.15 units. Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the identity euler angles ([0.0, 0.0, 0.0]) and a translation vector of [0.0, 0.0, 0.0].
